alert.note: Alert for Lexington; Richland (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 22 at 7:01PM EDT until June 26 at 2:00PM EDT by NWS Columbia
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of central South Carolina, including the following areas, Lexington, Newberry, Richland and Saluda. * WHEN...Until 900 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 701 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Columbia, Lexington, Irmo, Batesburg-Leesville, Red Bank, Highway 6 at Lake Murray Dam, Oak Grove, St. Andrews, Dreher Island State Park, Ballentine, Gilbert, Summit, Hollow Creek Public Park, Siesta Cove Marina, Oswald Park, Shull Island, Murray, South Shore Marina, Bundrick Island and Cedar Grove Fire Station. - This includes the following highways... Interstate 20 in South Carolina between mile markers 47 and 61. - http://www.floodsafety.noaa.gov
info.instruction: Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
